Rule.Name: sLatestC2RVersionNotInstalled15
Rule.Title: Office 2013 Click-to-run is not at the latest version
Rule.Text: You have version {0} while the latest available version is {1}. Please click the 'Click here...' link below to update your Office installation.

Rule.Name: sC2RUpdatesReadyToApply
Rule.Title: Updates for Click-to-Run are ready to be applied to Office
Rule.Text: Your Click-to-Run version is %C2RINSTALLEDVERSION% but you have an update ready to be applied to your Click-to-run installation of Office. Click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on how to get this update applied.

Rule.Name: sCustomBaseUrlPreSP1
Rule.Title: Custom baseurl value for Click-to-run specified in the registry
Rule.Text: The baseurl value (referring to the Office installation location) points to a custom location in the registry. Please check with your administrator to verify this location is correct.

Rule.Name: sCustomUpdateBaseUrlPreSP1
Rule.Title: Custom updatebaseurl for Click-to-run specified in the registry
Rule.Text: The updatebaseurl value (referring to the Office Click-to-run update location) points to a custom location in the registry. Please check with your administrator to verify this location is correct.

Rule.Name: sCustomUpdateUrlPostSP1
Rule.Title: Custom Update URL value for Click-to-run specified in the registry
Rule.Text: The UpdateURL value (referring to the Office Click-to-run update location) points to a custom location in the registry. Please check with your administrator to verify this location is correct.

Rule.Name: sC2RUpdatesDisabled
Rule.Title: Automatic updates for Click-to-Run are disabled
Rule.Text: Automatic updating of your Click-to-Run installation is disabled. It is recommended to enable this feature so Office has the latest updates installed.

Rule.Name: sC2RUpdatesDisabledPol
Rule.Title: Automatic updates for Click-to-Run are disabled by group policy
Rule.Text: Automatic updating of your Click-to-Run installation is disabled by policy. It is recommended to enable this feature so Office has the latest updates installed. See your administrator if you need to change this policy.

Rule.Name: sOffice14NoServicePack
Rule.Text: No service pack installed

Rule.Name: sOffice14SP1Installed
Rule.Text: Office 2010 Service Pack 1 (SP1) is installed

Rule.Name: sOffice14SP2Installed
Rule.Text: Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (SP2) is installed

Rule.Name: sOffice15SP1Installed
Rule.Text: Office 2013 Service Pack 1 (SP1) is installed

Rule.Name: sOffice15SP1SlipstreamInstalled
Rule.Text: Office 2013 has SP1 slipstreamed into the installation

Rule.Name: sOffice15NoServicePack
Rule.Text: No service pack installed

Rule.Name: sOffice16NoServicePack
Rule.Text: No service packs available yet

Rule.Name: sVMWare
Rule.Text: Office for Windows is running on VMware
Rule.Title: The configuration information indicates Office is running on virtualized hardware where the manufacturer is 'VMware, Inc.'.

Rule.Name: sApple
Rule.Text: Office for Windows is running on a Macintosh computer
Rule.Title: The computer manufacturer has been found to be either 'Apple, Inc' or 'Parallels Software International Inc.'. This indicates Office for Windows is running on a Macintosh computer.

Rule.Name: sMicrosoftVM
Rule.Text: Microsoft Virtual Machine detected

Rule.Name: sNotSupported2010Config
Rule.Title: Windows XP Service Pack 3 is not installed
Rule.Text: Office 2010 is installed on a computer with Windows XP and Service Pack 3 for Windows is not installed. Windows XP SP3 is a system requirement for Office 2010.

Rule.Name: sMissingDesktopXP
Rule.Title: Desktop Experience not installed, so some PowerPoint features are unavailable
Rule.Text: The Desktop Experience not installed for Windows. In this configuration, you may not be able to insert or edit video when using PowerPoint. If needed, please click the 'Click here to see possible solution ...' link below for instructions.

Rule.Name: nNoGPOSKULicenseCount
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Object/Instance/Object/Instance[(Setting[@Key1='LicenseFamily' and (contains(Value,'HomeBusiness')or contains(Value,'HomeStudent') or contains(Value,'O365Business') or contains(Value,'O365Home') or contains(Value,'O365SmallBus') or contains(Value,'Personal') or contains(Value,'Professional') or contains(Value,'StandardMSDN') or contains(Value,'StandardR'))]) and (Setting[@Key1='LicenseStatus' and Value=1])])

Rule.Name: sNoGPOSKULicense
Rule.Title: Group policy settings for Office 2013 were found but the Office 2013 license does not support group policies
Rule.Text: Group policy settings for Office 2013 were found in the registry but the Office 2013 license does not support group policies. To see the active Office 2013 license, click Find in Configuration Details and then search for 'Software Licenses'. Then, review the list of licences for the 'Office 15' SKU where LicenseStatus=1.

Rule.Name: sOfficePreviewersDisabled
Rule.Title: Office previewer disabled because the Windows Firewall service is not running
Rule.Text: You will receive an error in Outlook if you try to preview an Office file attached to an email message. This occurs because the Windows Firewall service is not running.

Rule.Name: AVScanningEnabledXP
Rule.Text: Your antivirus software ({0}) real-time scanning is not enabled.

Rule.Name: sNoAVRunningXP
Rule.Title: No antivirus scanning enabled
Rule.Text: Real-time antivirus software scanning is not enabled.

Rule.Name: AVOutOfDateXP
Rule.Title: Your antivirus software definitions are out of date
Rule.Text: Please check your antivirus software '{0}' as the definitions appear to be out of date.

Rule.Name: AVOutOfDate
Rule.Title: Your antivirus software definitions are out of date
Rule.Text: Please check your antivirus software '{0}' as the definitions appear to be out of date.

Rule.Name: AVRunning
Rule.Text: Your antivirus software '{0}' real-time scanning is enabled.

Rule.Name: AVNotRunning
Rule.Text: Your antivirus software '{0}' real-time scanning is not enabled.

Rule.Name: sNoAVRunning
Rule.Title: No antivirus scanning enabled
Rule.Text: Real-time antivirus software scanning is not enabled.

Rule.Name: sTouchDevice
Rule.Title: Touch enabled device.
Rule.Text: {0} is a touch enabled device.

Rule.Name: sVideoCardCrashesOutlook15
Rule.Title: Video card configuration may crash Outlook 2013
Rule.Text: Your video card has been known to crash Outlook 2013. If an updated video driver does not reduce crashes in Outlook, we recommend you disable Hardware Acceleration in Office programs. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sUnsupportVideoDriver
Rule.Title: Hardware acceleration is disabled by Office
Rule.Text: Hardware acceleration is disabled in Office programs because your video configuration is not compatible with Office 2013. Please update your video driver as your vendor may have an updated version that is compatible with Office 2013.

Rule.Name: sIntelVideoCard0166
Rule.Query: (../Instance[Setting[@Key1='DriverVersion' and Value='10.18.0010.3621'] and Setting[@Key1='PNPDeviceID' and Value='PCI\VEN_8086&DEV_0166']]) and $n2DigitVersion=15 and versioncompare($MSO_sMso2013Version,'15.0.4641.1001')<=0
Rule.Title: Video card configuration known to cause display issues in Office programs
Rule.Text: The configuration of your video card '{0}' has been known to cause video display problems in Office 2013 programs. To resolve this issue we recommend you update your video driver (version '{1}') to a newer version. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sIntelVideoCard0162
Rule.Query: (../Instance[Setting[@Key1='DriverVersion' and Value='10.18.0010.3621'] and Setting[@Key1='PNPDeviceID' and Value='PCI\VEN_8086&DEV_0162']]) and $n2DigitVersion=15 and versioncompare($MSO_sMso2013Version,'15.0.4641.1001')<=0
Rule.Title: Video card configuration known to cause display issues in Office programs
Rule.Text: The configuration of your video card '{0}' has been known to cause video display problems in Office 2013 programs. To resolve this issue we recommend you update your video driver (version '{1}') to a newer version. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sMultipleVideoCardsPlusHWAccelEnabled
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=15 and $appName='Outlook' and $MSO_fC2R2013SP1UpdateInstalled and $fIntelHDGraphics4000 and $fNVIDIACard and not($sDisableHardwareAcceleration)
Rule.Title: Outlook stops at 'Loading Profile' due to video hardware conflict
Rule.Text:
When you start Outlook 2013 the program stops at the 'Loading Profile' step. This problem occurs when the hardware acceleration feature in Office conflicts with video cards that need to have updated drivers installed.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for complete details and solutions.

Rule.Name: sDisableHardwareAcceleration
Rule.Title: Hardware acceleration is disabled
Rule.Text: You have hardware acceleration disabled. If you have been having video-related problems in Office programs, you should check for an updated video driver. If the driver upgrade fixes the problems, it is recommended you re-enable hardware acceleration.

Rule.Name: sSlowConnection
Rule.Title: Slow connection detected: {0}
Rule.Text: The network adapter speed is considered "slow" so, Outlook will use different behavior for some functions.

Rule.Name: sIPV6DisabledAll
Rule.Title: All IPv6 components are disabled except for the IPv6 loopback interface
Rule.Text: DisabledComponents={0} (decimal value) in the registry. In this configuration, all IPv6 components are disabled except for the IPv6 loopback interface.

Rule.Name: sPreferIPv4OverIPv6
Rule.Title: IPv4 preferred over IPv6
Rule.Text: DisabledComponents={0} (decimal value) in the registry. In this configuration, IPv4 is preferred over IPv6.

Rule.Name: sIPV6DisabledOnNonTunnelInterfaces
Rule.Title: IPv6 disabled on all non-tunnel interfaces
Rule.Text: DisabledComponents={0} (decimal value) in the registry. In this configuration, IPv6 is disabled on all non-tunnel interfaces.

Rule.Name: sIPV6DisabledOnAllTunnelInterfaces
Rule.Title: IPv6 disabled on all tunnel interfaces
Rule.Text: DisabledComponents={0} (decimal value) in the registry. In this configuration, IPv6 is disabled on all tunnel interfaces.

Rule.Name: sIPV6InterfacesDisabledNotIPV6Loopback
Rule.Title: IPv6 disabled on all interfaces except for the IPv6 loopback interface
Rule.Text: DisabledComponents={0} (decimal value) in the registry. In this configuration, IPv6 is disabled on all interfaces except for the IPv6 loopback interface.

Rule.Name: fDisabledComponentsNotFound
Rule.Text: DisabledComponents DWORD not found

Rule.Name: sMappedNetworkDriveNotReady
Rule.Title: Unreachable network drive {1} may cause performance problems in Office
Rule.Text: Mapped network drive cannot be reached. This configuration may cause performance problems in Microsoft Office programs.

Rule.Name: nUnreachableDrives
Rule.Title: All mapped network drives are reachable at this time
Rule.Text: All mapped network drives were reachable at the time this scan was run.

Rule.Name: sWinHCTheme
Rule.Query: contains($.,'hc1.theme') or contains($.,'hc2.theme') or contains($.,'hcblack.theme') or contains($.,'hcwhite.theme')

Rule.Name: sHighContrastTheme
Rule.Title: Windows theme is using a high-contrast setting
Rule.Text: Your current Windows theme is using one of the default high-contrast settings. In itself, this is not a problem. However, some high-contrast settings cause problems seeing shapes, drawings, menu items, or other objects in Office programs.

Rule.Name: sWin7BasicThemeOL14
Rule.Title: Windows 7 Basic Theme enabled and you are using Outlook 2010
Rule.Text: You have the Windows 7 Basic Theme enabled and you are using Outlook 2010. In this configuration, you may experience video issues that make it appear as if items are duplicated in Outlook.

Rule.Name: sSlashInUserDNTest
Rule.Title: Your distinguished name contains a slash mark (/)
Rule.Text: When your distinguished name contains a slash mark (/) character, you cannot configure Outlook profiles by using the Account Settings wizard.

Rule.Name: sAppsForOfficeEnabled
Rule.Title: Apps for Outlook are disabled in your organization.
Rule.Text: Your administrator has globally disabled all Apps for Outlook in your Exchange organization. Therefore, Apps for Outlook will not be displayed in Outlook or Outlook Web App (OWA).

Rule.Name: sCachedCreds
Rule.Title: Cached Credentials

Rule.Name: sRedirectedDesktopFolderUNC
Rule.Title: The Desktop folder is being redirected to a non-local location on the network.
Rule.Text: The Desktop string value in the registry refers to a network folder. This configuration has been known to cause problems in Office programs, but only if other conditions also exist in the environment. Click the 'Tell me more ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sMappedNetworkDriveDesktopFolder
Rule.Title: The Desktop folder is being redirected to a non-local location on the network.
Rule.Text: The Desktop string value in the registry refers to a network folder. This configuration has been known to cause problems in Office programs, but only if other conditions also exist in the environment. Click the 'Tell me more ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sNetworkDriveDesktopFolderFromEnvVar
Rule.Title: The Desktop folder is being redirected to a non-local location on the network.
Rule.Text: The Desktop string value in the registry refers to a network folder. This configuration has been known to cause problems in Office programs, but only if other conditions also exist in the environment. Click the 'Tell me more ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sRedirectedDocumentsFolderUNC
Rule.Title: The Documents folder is being redirected to a non-local location on the network.
Rule.Text: The Personal string value in the registry refers to the location of your Documents folder and it points to a network folder. This configuration has been known to cause problems in Office programs, but only if other conditions also exist in the environment. Click the 'Tell me more ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sMappedNetworkDocumentsFolder
Rule.Title: The Documents folder is being redirected to a non-local location on the network.
Rule.Text: The Personal string value in the registry refers to the location of your Documents folder and it points to a network folder. This configuration has been known to cause problems in Office programs, but only if other conditions also exist in the environment. Click the 'Tell me more ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sNetworkDriveDocumentsFolderFromEnvVar
Rule.Title: The Documents folder is being redirected to a non-local location on the network.
Rule.Text: The Personal string value in the registry refers to the location of your Documents folder and it points to a network folder. This configuration has been known to cause problems in Office programs, but only if other conditions also exist in the environment. Click the 'Tell me more ...' link below for details.

Rule.Name: sBluetoothAddinLoaded
Rule.Title: The Bluetooth add-in (BtOfficeAddin.BtOfficeIntegration.1) is enabled in the registry
Rule.Text: The Bluetooth add-in (ProgID=BtOfficeAddin.BtOfficeIntegration.1) is installed and configured to run with Office programs. This add-in has been known to cause problems with Office programs.

Rule.Name: sBluetoothAddinLoadedVisio
Rule.Title: The Bluetooth add-in (BtOfficeAddin.BtOfficeIntegration.1) is enabled in the registry
Rule.Text: The Bluetooth add-in (ProgID=BtOfficeAddin.BtOfficeIntegration.1) is installed and configured to run with Office programs. This add-in has been known to cause problems with Office programs.

Rule.Name: sBluetoothAddinLoadedWow
Rule.Title: The Bluetooth add-in (BtOfficeAddin.BtOfficeIntegration.1) is enabled under the \Wow6432Node key in the registry
Rule.Text: The Bluetooth add-in (ProgID=BtOfficeAddin.BtOfficeIntegration.1) is installed and configured to run with Office programs. This add-in has been known to cause problems with Office programs.

Rule.Name: sBluetoothAddinLoadedVisioWow
Rule.Title: The Bluetooth add-in (BtOfficeAddin.BtOfficeIntegration.1) is enabled under the \Wow6432Node key in the registry
Rule.Text: The Bluetooth add-in (ProgID=BtOfficeAddin.BtOfficeIntegration.1) is installed and configured to run with Office programs. This add-in has been known to cause problems with Office programs.

Rule.Name: sBtmOfficeDllCrash
Rule.Title: 'Send to Bluetooth' add-in has caused one or more crashes in {1}
Rule.Text: A third-party add-in called 'Send to Bluetooth' is installed and has caused at least one crash. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions...' link for details on how to disable this add-in.

Rule.Name: sBtmOfficeDllCrashWow
Rule.Title: 'Send to Bluetooth' add-in has caused one or more crashes in {1}
Rule.Text: A third-party add-in called 'Send to Bluetooth' is installed (registered under HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node) and has caused at least one crash in the last 14 days in {1}. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions...' link for details on how to disable this add-in.

Object.Key1: starts-with('%PROGID%','FineReader') or starts-with('%PROGID%','FRComAdd') or starts-with('%PROGID%','FRHEAdd') or starts-with('%PROGID%','btmoffice') or starts-with('%PROGID%','Evernote')

Rule.Name: fAddinReEnabledPostSP1
Rule.Text: This add-in was re-enabled by the user after SP1 was installed. This is OK as long as LoadBehavior is not 3.

Rule.Name: sOverrideDefaultDisableFR
Rule.Query: $MSO_fC2R2013SP1UpdateInstalled=true() and (starts-with('%PROGID%','FineReader') or starts-with('%PROGID%','FRComAdd') or starts-with('%PROGID%','FRHEAdd')) and $fOverrideDefaultDisable and $fLoadBehavior3
Rule.Title: The FineReader add-in that is known to cause crashing problems has been re-enabled
Rule.Text: You have a version of the FineReader add-in installed that has been known to crash Office 2013 programs. This version of the add-in is disabled in Office 2013 SP1, but you have re-enabled it. We recommend you disable this add-in until you install the most recent version.

Rule.Name: sOverrideDefaultDisableBT
Rule.Title: The 'Send to Bluetooth' add-in that is known to cause crashing problems has been re-enabled
Rule.Text: You have a version of the 'Send to Bluetooth' add-in installed that has been known to crash Office 2013 programs. This version of the add-in is disabled in Office 2013 SP1, but you have re-enabled it. We recommend you disable this add-in until you install the most recent version.

Rule.Name: sOverrideDefaultDisableEN
Rule.Title: The Evernote.Connect add-in that is known to cause crashing problems has been re-enabled
Rule.Text: You have a version of the Evernote.Connect add-in installed that has been known to crash Office 2013 programs. This version of the add-in is disabled in Office 2013 SP1, but you have re-enabled it. We recommend you disable this add-in until you install the most recent version.

Rule.Name: s80070005NotActivated
Rule.Title: Office Activation error 0x80070005 detected
Rule.Text: The activation error 0x80070005 was found in the Office Alerts log. This indicates your Office installation may not be activated. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on resolving this problem.

Rule.Name: s80041015May2014UpdateIssue
Rule.Title: System error: 0x80041015 displayed launching Office 2013 programs
Rule.Text: The error 0x80041015 was found in the Office Alerts log. If you are unable to start Office 2013 programs because you receive an error message containing 'System error: 0x80041015', please click the 'Click here ...' link below to get the hotfix that resolves this problem.

Rule.Name: sAppsForOfficeError
Rule.Title: Error starting an 'App for Office' detected
Rule.Text: At least one error was found in the Microsoft Office Alerts log (in the Event Viewer) indicating there was a problem starting an 'App for Office'. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for details on resolving this problem.

Rule.Name: nOfficeAppsAlertCount
Rule.Query: count(../Instance/Setting[@Key1='Message' and contains(Value,'could not be started')])>0

Rule.Name: sBadDCOMValues
Rule.Title: Machine configuration settings may prevent opening Office document attachments
Rule.Text: The DCOM settings on this computer may cause you to receive errors when you open Office documents from email attachments. If you are unable to open email attachments, click the FixIt link below to reconfigure your machine settings.

Rule.Name: sBrokenHtmRegistration
Rule.Title: Hyperlinks are not working in Outlook
Rule.Text:
When you click a hyperlink in Microsoft Outlook, you receive one of the following error messages, depending on your Outlook version:
This operation has been cancelled due to restrictions in effect on this computer. Please contact your system administrator.
Your organization's policies are preventing us from completing this action for you. For more info, please contact your help desk.

Rule.Name: sBrokenHtmRegistration8
Rule.Title: Hyperlinks are not working in Outlook
Rule.Text:
When you click a hyperlink in Microsoft Outlook, you receive one of the following error messages, depending on your Outlook version:
This operation has been cancelled due to restrictions in effect on this computer. Please contact your system administrator.
Your organization's policies are preventing us from completing this action for you. For more info, please contact your help desk.

Object.Name: Errors detected in %APPNAME% by the OffCAT service

Object.Key3: //ErrorMatch[not(Query/SolutionSourceId=preceding-sibling::ErrorMatch/Query/SolutionSourceId and translate(ProcessName, 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ', 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz')=translate(preceding-sibling::ErrorMatch/ProcessName, 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ', 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz') and ProcessDisplayVersion=preceding-sibling::ErrorMatch/ProcessDisplayVersion) and ProcessDisplayVersion='%DISPLAYVERSION%' and translate(ProcessName, 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ', 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz')=translate('%APPNAME%', 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ', 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz')]

Rule.Name: sErrorDetected
Rule.Title: The error from KB article %KBID% fired {0} times while you were using %APPNAME%
Rule.Text: Full error text = '%ERRTXT%'

Rule.Name: sTempIntFilesFolderEncrypted
Rule.Query: ../Instance/Object/Instance/Setting[@Key1='Encrypted']/Value='True' and (lower-case($appName)='excel' or lower-case($appName)='word' or lower-case($appName)='powerpoint' or lower-case($appName)='outlook') and versioncompare($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,'6.2.0.0')<0
Rule.Title: Files may save more slowly because the Temporary Internet Files folder is encrypted.
Rule.Text: The Temporary Internet Files folder 'Path = {0}' is encrypted. This configuration may cause files from {1} to save more slowly to network folder locations.

Rule.Name: sINetCacheFolderEncrypted
Rule.Query: ../Instance/Object/Instance/Setting[@Key1='Encrypted']/Value='True' and (lower-case($appName)='excel' or lower-case($appName)='word' or lower-case($appName)='powerpoint' or lower-case($appName)='outlook') and versioncompare($MachineDetails_WindowsVersion,'6.2.0.0')>=0
Rule.Title: Files may save more slowly because the INetCache folder is encrypted.
Rule.Text: The INetCache folder 'Path = {0}' is encrypted. This configuration may cause files from {1} to save more slowly to network folder locations.

Rule.Name: sBadApp
Rule.Title: Incorrect registry value found under the MSMapiApps registry key
Rule.Text: A string value called 'Version' was found under the \MSMapiApps key in the registry. This configuration can cause problems when sending files from within Office programs.

Rule.Name: sBadAppWow
Rule.Title: Incorrect registry value found under the MSMapiApps registry key
Rule.Text: A string value called 'Version' was found under the \MSMapiApps key in the registry. This configuration can cause problems when sending files from within Office programs.

Rule.Name: sMissingVBAKey
Rule.Title: Registry data for Visual Basic for Applications is missing
Rule.Text: The registry is missing data for Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) in Office 2010. In this configuration, you may have some VBA functionality disabled.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2RWow
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link below for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2R32
Rule.Query: ($fA32 or $fB32 or $fC or $fD32 or $fE32) and $bitness='x86' and $bitness=$MachineDetails_OSArchitecture
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link below for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2R64
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link below for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sWebClientStoppedOrDisabled
Rule.Query: ($fWebClientStopped or $fWebClientDisabled) and ($n2DigitVersion=12 or $n2DigitVersion=14) and (lower-case($appName)='excel' or lower-case($appName)='onenote' or lower-case($appName)='powerpoint' or lower-case($appName)='publisher' or lower-case($appName)='visio' or lower-case($appName)='word')
Rule.Title: The WebClient service is not running
Rule.Text: The WebClient service is not running and this will cause problems opening or saving Office documents from a SharePoint site. Please start the WebClient service using the Services.msc snap-in.

Rule.Name: sWebClientStoppedOrDisabledOnServer
Rule.Query: $fWindows2008OrAbove and ($fWebClientStopped or $fWebClientDisabled or not($fWebClientInstalled)) and ($n2DigitVersion=12 or $n2DigitVersion=14) and (lower-case($appName)='excel' or lower-case($appName)='onenote' or lower-case($appName)='powerpoint' or lower-case($appName)='publisher' or lower-case($appName)='visio' or lower-case($appName)='word')
Rule.Title: The WebClient service is not running on Windows Server
Rule.Text: The WebClient service is not running on Windows Server and this will cause problems opening or saving Office documents from a SharePoint site. Please start the WebClient service. If the WebClient service is not available, you will have to install the Desktop Experience first.

Rule.Name: sMSILoggingXP
Rule.Title: Windows Installer logging is enabled in the registry
Rule.Text: Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.

Rule.Name: sMSILogging
Rule.Title: Windows Installer logging is enabled in the registry
Rule.Text: Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.

Rule.Name: dlumd32VersionOld
Rule.Query: $nCrashCount>0 and $n2DigitVersion=15 and number($dlumd32Version)!=0 and substring($dlumd32Version,2,1)='.' and substring($dlumd32Version,4,1)='.' and number(substring($dlumd32Version,1,1))<9 and number(substring($dlumd32Version,3,1))<7
Rule.Title: Office programs may be crashing due to an outdated DisplayLink driver
Rule.Text: At least one Office 2013 program has crashed in the past 7 days and the DisplayLink user mode driver version on your machine has been known to cause Office programs to crash. Please install the 7.1 M1 update (or later version) for the DisplayLink driver.

Rule.Name: sMisMatchedMsmapi32VersionWordWow
Rule.Title: Error attempting to send Word document through email
Rule.Text: At least one error attempting to send a Word document through email has been detected. This is due to a later version of Msmapi32.dll being installed by an Office Language Pack in the '%COMMONPROGRAMFILESX86%\System\MSMAPI\%UILANGUAGECODE%' folder. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sMisMatchedMsmapi32VersionExcelWow
Rule.Title: Error attempting to send Excel workbook through email
Rule.Text: At least one error attempting to send an Excel workbook through email has been detected. This is due to a later version of Msmapi32.dll being installed by an Office Language Pack in the '%COMMONPROGRAMFILESX86%\System\MSMAPI\%UILANGUAGECODE%' folder. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sMisMatchedMsmapi32VersionPPTWow
Rule.Title: Error attempting to send PowerPoint file through email
Rule.Text: At least one error attempting to send a PowerPoint file through email has been detected. This is due to a later version of Msmapi32.dll being installed by an Office Language Pack in the '%COMMONPROGRAMFILESX86%\System\MSMAPI\%UILANGUAGECODE%' folder. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sMisMatchedMsmapi32VersionOutlookWow
Rule.Query: lower-case($appName)='outlook' and $n2DigitVersion<15 and ($CommonMisc_n200724WordError>0 or $CommonMisc_n400274PPTError>0 or $CommonMisc_n100796ExcelError>0) and $n2DigitVersion<number(substring($.,1,2))
Rule.Title: Error attempting to send Office files through emai
Rule.Text: At least one error attempting to send an Office file thorugh email has been detected. This is due to a later version of Msmapi32.dll being installed by an Office Language Pack in the '%COMMONPROGRAMFILESX86%\System\MSMAPI\%UILANGUAGECODE%' folder. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sMisMatchedMsmapi32VersionWord
Rule.Title: Error attempting to send Word document through email
Rule.Text: At least one error attempting to send a Word document through email has been detected. This is due to a later version of Msmapi32.dll being installed by an Office Language Pack in the '%COMMONPROGRAMFILES%\System\MSMAPI\%UILANGUAGECODE%' folder. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sMisMatchedMsmapi32VersionExcel
Rule.Title: Error attempting to send Excel workbook through email
Rule.Text: At least one error attempting to send an Excel workbook through email has been detected. This is due to a later version of Msmapi32.dll being installed by an Office Language Pack in the '%COMMONPROGRAMFILES%\System\MSMAPI\%UILANGUAGECODE%' folder. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sMisMatchedMsmapi32VersionPPT
Rule.Title: Error attempting to send PowerPoint file through email
Rule.Text: At least one error attempting to send a PowerPoint file through email has been detected. This is due to a later version of Msmapi32.dll being installed by an Office Language Pack in the '%COMMONPROGRAMFILES%\System\MSMAPI\%UILANGUAGECODE%' folder. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sMisMatchedMsmapi32VersionOutlook
Rule.Query: lower-case($appName)='outlook' and $n2DigitVersion<15 and ($CommonMisc_n200724WordError>0 or $CommonMisc_n400274PPTError>0 or $CommonMisc_n100796ExcelError>0) and $n2DigitVersion<number(substring($.,1,2))
Rule.Title: Error attempting to send Office files through email
Rule.Text: At least one error attempting to send an Office file thorugh email has been detected. This is due to a later version of Msmapi32.dll being installed by an Office Language Pack in the '%COMMONPROGRAMFILES%\System\MSMAPI\%UILANGUAGECODE%' folder. Please click the 'Click here ...' link below for steps to fix this problem.

Rule.Name: sMSOPRWow
Rule.Title: The build number for Mso.dll indicates a Private Release (PR) build and this is an unsupported configuration
Rule.Text: The build number for Mso.dll '{0}' indicates a Private Release (PR) build. PR builds are intended only for testing and not production use. Please click the 'Click here ...' link and then install the latest publicly available update for Mso.dll listed in the article.
